subject: Art & Design
title: Negative Space: The Power of Emptiness
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Negative Space: The Power of Emptiness.

hook.text: A tiny bird against a vast empty sky. The emptiness doesn't weaken the photo ‚Äî it amplifies the bird.

buildup.text: Negative space is the empty area surrounding the subject. It gives the subject room to breathe.

discovery.text: More negative space = more isolation = more visual weight on the subject. Less can be more.

twist.text: Beginners fill every inch of the frame. Experts know the empty parts tell the story too.

climax.text: Minimalist photographers use 90% negative space. The subject becomes a punctuation mark.

punchline.text: What you exclude from the frame is half the composition.

quiz.question: What effect does negative space have on the subject?
options: It isolates and amplifies visual weight on the subject
It makes the subject harder to see
